intro: Stauropsis pallens, commonly known as the pale stauropsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding structure, typical of bromeliads. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a color range from white to pale pink. Stauropsis pallens is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and rocky outcrops.
